National park in an amazing large volcano crater with a regular water course (there is no rivers in any island). Perfect for hiking
Super large white sand beach. Isolated and no population around. Get there after 9 kilometers of a not paved road (no problem even for small cars): this is the secret of its authenticity

Home made soup with large local fish (Mero, Sama). Served a fist course with soup and the fish and potatoes cooked in the soup separated as second course
Islands: Gran Canaria, Fuerteventura, Lanzarote, La Palma

"Beach lover? this is your route. A selection of the best beaches in all the islands, from white sand ones to the special local ones with Black sand (volcano origin). Cofete Beach (Fuerteventura), Cotillo Beach (Fuerteventura), Corralejo (Fuerteventura), Maspalomas (Gran Canaria), Nogales Beach (La Palma), Famara (Lanzarote)"

"Lanzarote offers the major Volcano interest for visitors in Timanfaya National Park. Tenerife has the Teide National Park where an isolated volcano is the highest peak of Spain. However, do not miss La Palma, the most active volcanoes today and recent eruptions took placed here in 2021"
Islands: La Palma, La Gomera, Tenerife, Gran Canaria, El Hierro

"All these islands offer the paradise for hiking lovers of all levels. Difficult routes but also very familiy tailored ones. Some islands offer annual hiking events which facilitates the planning and logistics and offer guides"
